snippet: A vaccine that protects women against cervical cancer also appears to protect them against throat cancers caused by oral sex, according to a study released Thursday.
abstract: National Cancer Institute study finds that human papillomavirus vaccine, which protects women against cervical cancer, also appears to protect them against cancers caused by oral sex and presumably would protect men as well; rates of throat cancer have soared over past 30 years and about 70 percent are caused by sexually transmitted diseases.
lead_paragraph: A vaccine that protects women against cervical cancer also appears to protect them against throat cancers caused by oral sex, according to a study released Thursday.

headline.main: HPV Vaccine Found to Help With Cancers of Throat
headline.print_headline: HPV Vaccine Found to Help With Cancers Of Throat
